title: ACID BATH's DAX RIGGS Streams New Solo Single "Even The Stars Fall"
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 5 hours ago
text: Acid Bath frontman Dax Riggs is gonna have one hell of a 2025. Acid Bath has reunited for some reunion shows, and Riggs himself is releasing his first new album in 15 years named 7 Songs For Spiders, due out January 24. Riggs is now streaming the single "Even The Stars Fall", about which he said: "A meditation on human collapse and how failure creates the only heaven we'll ever know. GET UNDEAD! BE ALIVE NOW! Cause even the stars fall." 7 Songs For Spiders was written at Riggs' home in Acadiana, a region settled by descendants of French exiles from Canada. "I've always felt a connection with the spirit of this place," said Riggs of the location. "There's a vacuum for rock music here in 'Cajun hell,' so it's the perfect place to go inside yourself–where I've always gone." 7 Songs For Spiders features guitarist and synth player Lucas Broussard, bassist Kane Cormier, and percussionist Scott Domingue. Pre-orders for 7 Songs For Spiders are available here. Want More Metal?
